channel.title: CVE Feed for Elastic -- Kibana
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Elastic -- Kibana

item.title: CVE-2021-22136|2024-08-03T18:30:23.975Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: In Kibana versions before 7.12.0 and 6.8.15 a flaw in the session timeout was discovered where the xpack.security.session.idleTimeout setting is not being respected. This was caused by background polling activities unintentionally extending authenticated users sessions, preventing a user session from timing out.

item.title: CVE-2021-22150|2024-08-03T18:37:18.497Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: It was discovered that a user with Fleet admin permissions could upload a malicious package. Due to using an older version of the js-yaml library, this package would be loaded in an insecure manner, allowing an attacker to execute commands on the Kibana server.

item.title: CVE-2021-22142|2024-08-03T18:37:17.271Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana contains an embedded version of the Chromium browser that the Reporting feature uses to generate the downloadable reports. If a user with permissions to generate reports is able to render arbitrary HTML with this browser, they may be able to leverage known Chromium vulnerabilities to conduct further attacks. Kibana contains a number of protections to prevent this browser from rendering arbitrary content.

item.title: CVE-2021-22139|2024-08-03T18:30:23.946Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: Kibana versions before 7.12.1 contain a denial of service vulnerability was found in the webhook actions due to a lack of timeout or a limit on the request size. An attacker with permissions to create webhook actions could drain the Kibana host connection pool, making Kibana unavailable for all other users.

item.title: CVE-2021-22141|2024-08-03T18:37:16.700Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect flaw was found in Kibana versions before 7.13.0 and 6.8.16. If a logged in user visits a maliciously crafted URL, it could result in Kibana redirecting the user to an arbitrary website.

item.title: CVE-2022-23713|2024-08-03T03:51:46.084Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability was discovered in the Vega Charts Kibana integration which could allow arbitrary JavaScript to be executed in a victim’s browser.

item.title: CVE-2022-38779|2024-08-03T11:02:14.674Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

item.title: CVE-2022-38778|2024-08-03T11:02:14.627Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw (CVE-2022-38900) was discovered in one of Kibana’s third party dependencies, that could allow an authenticated user to perform a request that crashes the Kibana server process.

item.title: CVE-2022-23707|2024-08-03T03:51:45.679Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An XSS vulnerability was found in Kibana index patterns. Using this vulnerability, an authenticated user with permissions to create index patterns can inject malicious javascript into the index pattern which could execute against other users

item.title: CVE-2022-23709|2024-08-03T03:51:46.009Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana in which users with Read access to the Uptime feature could modify alerting rules. A user with this privilege would be able to create new alerting rules or overwrite existing ones. However, any new or modified rules would not be enabled, and a user with this privilege could not modify alerting connectors. This effectively means that Read users could disable existing alerting rules.

item.title: CVE-2021-22151|2024-08-03T18:37:16.711Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: It was discovered that Kibana was not validating a user supplied path, which would load .pbf files. Because of this, a malicious user could arbitrarily traverse the Kibana host to load internal files ending in the .pbf extension.

item.title: CVE-2022-23710|2024-08-03T03:51:45.928Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability was discovered in the Data Preview Pane (previously known as Index Pattern Preview Pane) which could allow arbitrary JavaScript to be executed in a victim’s browser.

item.title: CVE-2022-23711|2024-08-03T03:51:45.563Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A vulnerability in Kibana could expose sensitive information related to Elastic Stack monitoring in the Kibana page source. Elastic Stack monitoring features provide a way to keep a pulse on the health and performance of your Elasticsearch cluster. Authentication with a vulnerable Kibana instance is not required to view the exposed information. The Elastic Stack monitoring exposure only impacts users that have set any of the optional monitoring.ui.elasticsearch.* settings in order to configure Kibana as a remote UI for Elastic Stack Monitoring. The same vulnerability in Kibana could expose other non-sensitive application-internal information in the page source.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-08-02T03:50:55.963Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-08-02T03:50:55.975Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-07-30T21:48:17.598Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.

item.title: CVE-2024-23443|2024-06-19T13:47:29.166Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 17 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.

item.title: CVE-2024-23442|2024-06-14T14:26:53.169Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-06-13T17:04:41.737Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-23446|2024-02-07T03:16:39.182Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered by Elastic, whereby the Detection Engine Search API does not respect Document-level security (DLS) or Field-level security (FLS) when querying the .alerts-security.alerts-{space_id} indices. Users who are authorized to call this API may obtain unauthorized access to documents if their roles are configured with DLS or FLS against the aforementioned index.

item.title: CVE-2024-37279|2024-06-13T19:11:54.538Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A flaw was discovered in Kibana, allowing view-only users of alerting to use the run_soon API making the alerting rule run continuously, potentially affecting the system availability if the alerting rule is running complex queries.

item.title: CVE-2024-23442|2024-06-14T18:01:40.563Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An open redirect issue was discovered in Kibana that could lead to a user being redirected to an arbitrary website if they use a maliciously crafted Kibana URL.

item.title: CVE-2024-23443|2024-06-21T14:43:38.725Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: A high-privileged user, allowed to create custom osquery packs 17 could affect the availability of Kibana by uploading a maliciously crafted osquery pack.

item.title: CVE-2024-37281|2024-07-31T13:59:39.692Z -- elastic -- kibana
item.description: An issue was discovered in Kibana where a user with Viewer role could cause a Kibana instance to crash by sending a large number of maliciously crafted requests to a specific endpoint.
